accessibility: Well-paved paths, wheelchair-friendly in main areas
guided_tours: Available via local guides; English/Hindi support
nearby_amenities: Cafes, shops, hotels, restrooms in Kohima town
special_notes: Maintains graves of soldiers of WWII; famous epitaph “When You Go Home, Tell Them of Us and Say, For Your Tomorrow, We Gave Our Today.”

place_name: Dzukou Valley, Kohima District (Nagaland & Manipur border)
timings: Trekking access during daylight; overnight camping allowed
best_time: June – September (valley in full bloom); October – March (cool and dry for trekking)
nearest_bus: Kohima Bus Stand (~25 km to trek base)
accessibility: Trekking only; moderate difficulty; not wheelchair accessible
nearby_amenities: Homestays, small food stalls at base villages
special_notes: Famous for Dzukou Lilies, rolling green meadows, camping under stars.

place_name: Hornbill Festival (Kisama Heritage Village, Kohima District, Nagaland)
nearest_bus: Kohima Bus Stand (~12 km from Kisama)
accessibility: Well-connected by road, hilly terrain; not fully wheelchair accessible
guided_tours: Cultural tours arranged by Nagaland Tourism/local operators
nearby_amenities: Food stalls, cultural shops, handicraft bazaars, hotels in Kohima
special_notes: Known as the “Festival of Festivals”; showcases dances, crafts, indigenous sports, and cuisines of all 16 Naga tribes.

place_name: Nagaland Zoological Park, Rangapahar (Chümoukedima District, Nagaland)
accessibility: Good road approach; partial wheelchair access
guided_tours: Zoo staff available; educational tours arranged
nearby_amenities: Small canteen, restrooms; hotels/restaurants in Dimapur
special_notes: Home to hornbills, hoolock gibbons, rare Himalayan species; popular with school groups.

place_name: Pulie Badze Wildlife Sanctuary, Kohima District (Nagaland)
nearest_bus: Kohima Bus Stand (~15 km to Jotsoma village)
accessibility: Requires trek from Jotsoma; moderate difficulty; not wheelchair friendly
nearby_amenities: Homestays in Kohima; small shops/restrooms in villages
special_notes: Known for Blyth’s Tragopan (Nagaland’s state bird); scenic views of Kohima.

guided_tours: Available by request; staff assist with plant info
nearby_amenities: Cafés, shops, restrooms in Kohima city
special_notes: Offers panoramic city views; rich flora; popular for leisure and picnics.

timings: Open all day; best in daylight
nearest_bus: Kohima Bus Stand (~20 km to Khonoma)
accessibility: Good road; hilly terrain; not wheelchair friendly
special_notes: India’s first Green Village; strong conservation practices; rich Angami tribal culture.

accessibility: Motorable road; last stretch rural roads; not wheelchair friendly
guided_tours: Local guides available from Phek villages
nearby_amenities: Guest houses in Phek; small stalls near lake
special_notes: Known as “Lake of Spirits”; cultural myths; scenic for photography.

category: Hill Station / Cultural Town / Trekking Spot
best_time: November (Tokhu Emong festival); October – March for good weather
accessibility: Good roads; trekking paths steep at Mount Tiyi; not wheelchair friendly
guided_tours: Available with local Lotha tribe guides
nearby_amenities: Markets, restaurants, rest houses in Wokha town
special_notes: Known for orange orchards, Mount Tiyi trekking, and Lotha tribe’s Tokhu Emong festival.

accessibility: Motorable road; village paths uneven; not wheelchair friendly
special_notes: Preserves Angami traditions; traditional huts, food, crafts; immersive stay
